Description: Tondo and foot sherd of Attic black-figured pottery type C stemless cup; interior: black-figure gorgoneion (part of left ear, eye, nose, mouth, protruding tongue in added red, teeth and fangs in added white, and beard remaining); red band and black area around tondo; exterior glazed streaky black; red band on fillet joining bowl and foot; edge of foot and resting surface reserved; underside of foot reserved with one black and one red band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see Bristol H2015, Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA224 and British Museum 1886,0401.1160.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 438, no. B713)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0678) (Phase 1)
